pomelli-dresses-refresh.title: Refresh Dresses product images (Pomelli photoshoot -> Shopify upload)
pomelli-dresses-refresh.summary: For each active product in Dresses collection, generate 4 Pomelli lifestyle images and upload them to the matching Shopify product with alt text and saved state.

context.summary: Execution is product-by-product from top to bottom; do not start product B until product A is fully uploaded and saved.
context.why_exists: The worker agent runs in a fresh context window, so this card is the complete execution brief and source of truth.
constraints: Use currently open logged-in Chrome sessions.
Do not rename the downloaded original main image filename.
Use original filename as Shopify lookup key first, then product title fallback.
Do not save Shopify product until all 4 new images have alt text.
decisions: Pause requested by human until explicit resume command.
First product already handled manually by human; resume from second dress.
context.goal: Every active Dresses product has 4 new Pomelli images (flatlay, model try-on, in use, easter), uploaded to Shopify with descriptive alt text and a DONE/SKIP log line.

tools.how: Open collection, Pomelli, and Shopify tabs and process one product at a time.
Store 1 original image + 4 generated outputs per product; use date-modified sorting when ambiguous.
Upload 4 images, set alt text, reorder hero image, save and verify.

steps.text: A) Identify product and download original main image
procedure: Go to Dresses collection and open product page starting from top item, then continue top-to-bottom.
Download the primary product image to Downloads without renaming.
Capture exact filename as OriginalImageFilename.
steps.definitionOfDone: One original main image is downloaded and filename captured for lookup.

steps.text: B) Generate 4 Pomelli outputs and download
procedure: Open Pomelli photoshoot and upload OriginalImageFilename image.
Select templates: flatlay, model try on, in use, easter.
Run generation, wait for render completion, download all 4 outputs.
steps.definitionOfDone: Exactly 4 new Pomelli images for the current product are in Downloads.

steps.text: C/D) Match Shopify listing, upload images, set alt text, save
procedure: Search Shopify by OriginalImageFilename first, then fallback to product title.
Confirm correct product and Active status; skip if Draft/Archived.
Upload 4 Pomelli images and set alt text format: [Full Product Title] — [template descriptor].
Save and confirm no unsaved changes indicator remains.
steps.definitionOfDone: Shopify product saved with 4 new images and complete alt text.

steps.text: Tracking and error-handling
procedure: After each product append DONE line: DONE | ProductTitle | OriginalImageFilename | PomelliOutputs=4 | ShopifySaved=Yes | Notes=...
If skipped append SKIP line with reason: NotActive / NotFound / PomelliError / UploadError / Other.
On Pomelli hang/fail: refresh once, retry once, then SKIP PomelliError and move on.
steps.definitionOfDone: Each processed product has one DONE/SKIP line for reliable resume and dedupe.

acceptanceCriteria: Every active Dresses product has 4 new Pomelli images uploaded to correct Shopify listing.
All 4 newly uploaded images per product have factual descriptive alt text.
Each product is saved in Shopify with no unsaved indicator.
DONE/SKIP tracking lines exist for each processed product to support resumability.

handoff.whatIsDone: Workflow/SOP captured; first dress already completed manually by human; automation permission setup partially validated.
handoff.nextAction: When resumed, start at second dress and execute steps A->D product-by-product.

we-need-to-improve-the-task-card.summary: Replace weak/mixed task cards with complete handoff packets and enforce guardrails so modal content stays task-specific.
we-need-to-improve-the-task-card.goal: Every task card shown in Mission Control is self-contained for a fresh worker agent: clear title, context, links, tools, step-by-step plan, acceptance criteria, and handoff.

context.summary: Task cards were showing boilerplate/noise and low-quality autogenerated titles; agents lacked enough context to execute work in a fresh window.
context.why_exists: The task card is the worker agent capsule; when it is thin or polluted, execution quality collapses and the board becomes unreliable.
constraints: Do not render global operating-principles text inside task modal content.
Do not use task slug/id as primary display title when richer fields exist.
Support existing legacy task payloads without breaking the UI.
decisions: Enforce deterministic title precedence (title > summary > goal > next_action > humanized id).
Auto-sanitize boilerplate/noise strings server-side before rendering.
Normalize tasks to a complete handoff shape (summary, goal, context, steps, acceptance, handoff).
context.goal: Every task card shown in Mission Control is self-contained for a fresh worker agent: clear title, context, links, tools, step-by-step plan, acceptance criteria, and handoff.

tools.how: Patch runtime code, validate behavior, and run targeted tests.
Open board/modal and confirm rendered sections and titles.

acceptanceCriteria: Task modal top section shows task summary/goal/context instead of global boilerplate.
Task cards display clean human titles (not slug/id unless no other data exists).
Each active task has enough detail for a new worker to execute without extra context.
Low-signal/noise chat messages no longer auto-generate garbage task titles.

handoff.whatIsDone: Core rendering/sanitization patches are implemented in index.html and activity-server.py; task-board guardrails are being hardened.
handoff.nextAction: Run verification on API/UI output, then lock final card data quality in tasks.json.
